Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which 49% of all new income goes to the top 1%.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to back up the statistic.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the distribution of income is inherently unfair and that the top 1% should not be receiving such a large portion of new income.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the income distribution, such as differences in skills, education, or entrepreneurial success.
